Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that Will Smith was "rushed to hospital" and "diagnosed with a life-threatening disease" when in reality he underwent a routine colonoscopy and was not diagnosed with any disease.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on a misleading YouTube video and misinterpreted information from an AmoMama article.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the problematic assumption that undergoing a routine colonoscopy automatically means being diagnosed with a life-threatening disease.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Will Smith was not diagnosed with a life-threatening disease and was not rushed to the hospital.
Understate: The claim understates the significance of Will Smith's decision to undergo a routine colonoscopy, which potentially prevented cancer from developing.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to consider the alternative explanation that the tissue growth discovered during the colonoscopy was a pre-cancerous polyp, which required further screening in a shorter interval.
